00007 static const idScalar kIsZero = 5 * std::numeric_limits<idScalar>::epsilon();
00008 // requirements for axis length deviation from 1.0
00009 // experimentally set from random euler angle rotation matrices
00010 static const idScalar kAxisLengthEpsilon = 10 * kIsZero;

00013         v(0) = 0;
00014         v(1) = 0;
00015         v(2) = 0;

00019         for (int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++) {
00020                 v(i) = 0;

00024 void setZero(mat33 &m) {
00025         m(0, 0) = 0;
00026         m(0, 1) = 0;
00027         m(0, 2) = 0;
00028         m(1, 0) = 0;
00029         m(1, 1) = 0;
00030         m(1, 2) = 0;
00031         m(2, 0) = 0;
00032         m(2, 1) = 0;
00033         m(2, 2) = 0;
00034 }
00035 
00036 void skew(vec3& v, mat33* result) {
00037         (*result)(0, 0) = 0.0;
00038         (*result)(0, 1) = -v(2);
00039         (*result)(0, 2) = v(1);
00040         (*result)(1, 0) = v(2);
00041         (*result)(1, 1) = 0.0;
00042         (*result)(1, 2) = -v(0);
00043         (*result)(2, 0) = -v(1);
00044         (*result)(2, 1) = v(0);
00045         (*result)(2, 2) = 0.0;
00046 }

00048 idScalar maxAbs(const vecx &v) {
00049         idScalar result = 0.0;
00050         for (int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++) {
00051                 const idScalar tmp = BT_ID_FABS(v(i));
00052                 if (tmp > result) {
00053                         result = tmp;
00054                 }
00055         }
00056         return result;
00057 }

00059 idScalar maxAbs(const vec3 &v) {
00060         idScalar result = 0.0;
00061         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00062                 const idScalar tmp = BT_ID_FABS(v(i));
00063                 if (tmp > result) {
00064                         result = tmp;
00065                 }
00066         }
00067         return result;
00068 }

00070 #if (defined BT_ID_HAVE_MAT3X)
00071 idScalar maxAbsMat3x(const mat3x &m) {
00072     // only used for tests -- so just loop here for portability
00073     idScalar result = 0.0;
00074     for (idArrayIdx col = 0; col < m.cols(); col++) {
00075         for (idArrayIdx row = 0; row < 3; row++) {
00076             result = BT_ID_MAX(result, std::fabs(m(row, col)));
00077         }
00078     }
00079     return result;
00080 }

00082 void mul(const mat33 &a, const mat3x &b, mat3x *result) {
00083     if (b.cols() != result->cols()) {
00084         error_message("size missmatch. b.cols()= %d, result->cols()= %d\n",
00085                       static_cast<int>(b.cols()), static_cast<int>(result->cols()));
00086         abort();
00087     }
00088 
00089     for (idArrayIdx col = 0; col < b.cols(); col++) {
00090         const idScalar x = a(0,0)*b(0,col)+a(0,1)*b(1,col)+a(0,2)*b(2,col);
00091         const idScalar y = a(1,0)*b(0,col)+a(1,1)*b(1,col)+a(1,2)*b(2,col);
00092         const idScalar z = a(2,0)*b(0,col)+a(2,1)*b(1,col)+a(2,2)*b(2,col);
00093         setMat3xElem(0, col, x, result);
00094         setMat3xElem(1, col, y, result);
00095         setMat3xElem(2, col, z, result);
00096     }
00097 }
00098 void add(const mat3x &a, const mat3x &b, mat3x *result) {
00099     if (a.cols() != b.cols()) {
00100         error_message("size missmatch. a.cols()= %d, b.cols()= %d\n",
00101                       static_cast<int>(a.cols()), static_cast<int>(b.cols()));
00102         abort();
00103     }
00104     for (idArrayIdx col = 0; col < b.cols(); col++) {
00105         for (idArrayIdx row = 0; row < 3; row++) {
00106             setMat3xElem(row, col, a(row, col) + b(row, col), result);
00107         }
00108     }
00109 }
00110 void sub(const mat3x &a, const mat3x &b, mat3x *result) {
00111     if (a.cols() != b.cols()) {
00112         error_message("size missmatch. a.cols()= %d, b.cols()= %d\n",
00113                       static_cast<int>(a.cols()), static_cast<int>(b.cols()));
00114         abort();
00115     }
00116     for (idArrayIdx col = 0; col < b.cols(); col++) {
00117         for (idArrayIdx row = 0; row < 3; row++) {
00118             setMat3xElem(row, col, a(row, col) - b(row, col), result);
00119         }
00120     }
00121 }

00123 
00124 mat33 transformX(const idScalar &alpha) {
00125         mat33 T;
00126         const idScalar cos_alpha = BT_ID_COS(alpha);
00127         const idScalar sin_alpha = BT_ID_SIN(alpha);
00128         // [1  0 0]
00129         // [0  c s]
00130         // [0 -s c]
00131         T(0, 0) = 1.0;
00132         T(0, 1) = 0.0;
00133         T(0, 2) = 0.0;
00134 
00135         T(1, 0) = 0.0;
00136         T(1, 1) = cos_alpha;
00137         T(1, 2) = sin_alpha;
00138 
00139         T(2, 0) = 0.0;
00140         T(2, 1) = -sin_alpha;
00141         T(2, 2) = cos_alpha;
00142 
00143         return T;
00144 }
00145 
00146 mat33 transformY(const idScalar &beta) {
00147         mat33 T;
00148         const idScalar cos_beta = BT_ID_COS(beta);
00149         const idScalar sin_beta = BT_ID_SIN(beta);
00150         // [c 0 -s]
00151         // [0 1  0]
00152         // [s 0  c]
00153         T(0, 0) = cos_beta;
00154         T(0, 1) = 0.0;
00155         T(0, 2) = -sin_beta;
00156 
00157         T(1, 0) = 0.0;
00158         T(1, 1) = 1.0;
00159         T(1, 2) = 0.0;
00160 
00161         T(2, 0) = sin_beta;
00162         T(2, 1) = 0.0;
00163         T(2, 2) = cos_beta;
00164 
00165         return T;
00166 }
00167 
00168 mat33 transformZ(const idScalar &gamma) {
00169         mat33 T;
00170         const idScalar cos_gamma = BT_ID_COS(gamma);
00171         const idScalar sin_gamma = BT_ID_SIN(gamma);
00172         // [ c s 0]
00173         // [-s c 0]
00174         // [ 0 0 1]
00175         T(0, 0) = cos_gamma;
00176         T(0, 1) = sin_gamma;
00177         T(0, 2) = 0.0;
00178 
00179         T(1, 0) = -sin_gamma;
00180         T(1, 1) = cos_gamma;
00181         T(1, 2) = 0.0;
00182 
00183         T(2, 0) = 0.0;
00184         T(2, 1) = 0.0;
00185         T(2, 2) = 1.0;
00186 
00187         return T;
00188 }
00189 
00190 mat33 tildeOperator(const vec3 &v) {
00191         mat33 m;
00192         m(0, 0) = 0.0;
00193         m(0, 1) = -v(2);
00194         m(0, 2) = v(1);
00195         m(1, 0) = v(2);
00196         m(1, 1) = 0.0;
00197         m(1, 2) = -v(0);
00198         m(2, 0) = -v(1);
00199         m(2, 1) = v(0);
00200         m(2, 2) = 0.0;
00201         return m;
00202 }

00204 void getVecMatFromDH(idScalar theta, idScalar d, idScalar a, idScalar alpha, vec3 *r, mat33 *T) {
00205         const idScalar sa = BT_ID_SIN(alpha);
00206         const idScalar ca = BT_ID_COS(alpha);
00207         const idScalar st = BT_ID_SIN(theta);
00208         const idScalar ct = BT_ID_COS(theta);
00209 
00210         (*r)(0) = a;
00211         (*r)(1) = -sa * d;
00212         (*r)(2) = ca * d;
00213 
00214         (*T)(0, 0) = ct;
00215         (*T)(0, 1) = -st;
00216         (*T)(0, 2) = 0.0;
00217 
00218         (*T)(1, 0) = st * ca;
00219         (*T)(1, 1) = ct * ca;
00220         (*T)(1, 2) = -sa;
00221 
00222         (*T)(2, 0) = st * sa;
00223         (*T)(2, 1) = ct * sa;
00224         (*T)(2, 2) = ca;
00225 }
00226 
00227 void bodyTParentFromAxisAngle(const vec3 &axis, const idScalar &angle, mat33 *T) {
00228         const idScalar c = BT_ID_COS(angle);
00229         const idScalar s = -BT_ID_SIN(angle);
00230         const idScalar one_m_c = 1.0 - c;
00231 
00232         const idScalar &x = axis(0);
00233         const idScalar &y = axis(1);
00234         const idScalar &z = axis(2);
00235 
00236         (*T)(0, 0) = x * x * one_m_c + c;
00237         (*T)(0, 1) = x * y * one_m_c - z * s;
00238         (*T)(0, 2) = x * z * one_m_c + y * s;
00239 
00240         (*T)(1, 0) = x * y * one_m_c + z * s;
00241         (*T)(1, 1) = y * y * one_m_c + c;
00242         (*T)(1, 2) = y * z * one_m_c - x * s;
00243 
00244         (*T)(2, 0) = x * z * one_m_c - y * s;
00245         (*T)(2, 1) = y * z * one_m_c + x * s;
00246         (*T)(2, 2) = z * z * one_m_c + c;
00247 }
00248 
00249 bool isPositiveDefinite(const mat33 &m) {
00250         // test if all upper left determinants are positive
00251         if (m(0, 0) <= 0) {  // upper 1x1
00252                 return false;
00253         }
00254         if (m(0, 0) * m(1, 1) - m(0, 1) * m(1, 0) <= 0) {  // upper 2x2
00255                 return false;
00256         }
00257         if ((m(0, 0) * (m(1, 1) * m(2, 2) - m(1, 2) * m(2, 1)) -
00258                  m(0, 1) * (m(1, 0) * m(2, 2) - m(1, 2) * m(2, 0)) +
00259                  m(0, 2) * (m(1, 0) * m(2, 1) - m(1, 1) * m(2, 0))) < 0) {
00260                 return false;
00261         }
00262         return true;
00263 }
00264 
00265 bool isPositiveSemiDefinite(const mat33 &m) {
00266         // test if all upper left determinants are positive
00267         if (m(0, 0) < 0) {  // upper 1x1
00268                 return false;
00269         }
00270         if (m(0, 0) * m(1, 1) - m(0, 1) * m(1, 0) < 0) {  // upper 2x2
00271                 return false;
00272         }
00273         if ((m(0, 0) * (m(1, 1) * m(2, 2) - m(1, 2) * m(2, 1)) -
00274                  m(0, 1) * (m(1, 0) * m(2, 2) - m(1, 2) * m(2, 0)) +
00275                  m(0, 2) * (m(1, 0) * m(2, 1) - m(1, 1) * m(2, 0))) < 0) {
00276                 return false;
00277         }
00278         return true;
00279 }
00280 
00281 bool isPositiveSemiDefiniteFuzzy(const mat33 &m) {
00282         // test if all upper left determinants are positive
00283         if (m(0, 0) < -kIsZero) {  // upper 1x1
00284                 return false;
00285         }
00286         if (m(0, 0) * m(1, 1) - m(0, 1) * m(1, 0) < -kIsZero) {  // upper 2x2
00287                 return false;
00288         }
00289         if ((m(0, 0) * (m(1, 1) * m(2, 2) - m(1, 2) * m(2, 1)) -
00290                  m(0, 1) * (m(1, 0) * m(2, 2) - m(1, 2) * m(2, 0)) +
00291                  m(0, 2) * (m(1, 0) * m(2, 1) - m(1, 1) * m(2, 0))) < -kIsZero) {
00292                 return false;
00293         }
00294         return true;
00295 }
00296 
00297 idScalar determinant(const mat33 &m) {
00298         return m(0, 0) * m(1, 1) * m(2, 2) + m(0, 1) * m(1, 2) * m(2, 0) + m(0, 2) * m(1, 0) * m(2, 1) -
00299                    m(0, 2) * m(1, 1) * m(2, 0) - m(0, 0) * m(1, 2) * m(2, 1) - m(0, 1) * m(1, 0) * m(2, 2);
00300 }

00302 bool isValidInertiaMatrix(const mat33 &I, const int index, bool has_fixed_joint) {
00303         // TODO(Thomas) do we really want this?
00304         //                        in cases where the inertia tensor about the center of mass is zero,
00305         //                        the determinant of the inertia tensor about the joint axis is almost
00306         //                        zero and can have a very small negative value.
00307         if (!isPositiveSemiDefiniteFuzzy(I)) {
00308                 error_message("invalid inertia matrix for body %d, not positive definite "
00309                                           "(fixed joint)\n",
00310                                           index);
00311                 error_message("matrix is:\n"
00312                                           "[%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00313                                           "%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00314                                           "%.20e %.20e %.20e]\n",
00315                                           I(0, 0), I(0, 1), I(0, 2), I(1, 0), I(1, 1), I(1, 2), I(2, 0), I(2, 1),
00316                                           I(2, 2));
00317 
00318                 return false;
00319         }
00320 
00321         // check triangle inequality, must have I(i,i)+I(j,j)>=I(k,k)
00322         if (!has_fixed_joint) {
00323                 if (I(0, 0) + I(1, 1) < I(2, 2)) {
00324                         error_message("invalid inertia tensor for body %d, I(0,0) + I(1,1) < I(2,2)\n", index);
00325                         error_message("matrix is:\n"
00326                                                   "[%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00327                                                   "%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00328                                                   "%.20e %.20e %.20e]\n",
00329                                                   I(0, 0), I(0, 1), I(0, 2), I(1, 0), I(1, 1), I(1, 2), I(2, 0), I(2, 1),
00330                                                   I(2, 2));
00331                         return false;
00332                 }
00333                 if (I(0, 0) + I(1, 1) < I(2, 2)) {
00334                         error_message("invalid inertia tensor for body %d, I(0,0) + I(1,1) < I(2,2)\n", index);
00335                         error_message("matrix is:\n"
00336                                                   "[%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00337                                                   "%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00338                                                   "%.20e %.20e %.20e]\n",
00339                                                   I(0, 0), I(0, 1), I(0, 2), I(1, 0), I(1, 1), I(1, 2), I(2, 0), I(2, 1),
00340                                                   I(2, 2));
00341                         return false;
00342                 }
00343                 if (I(1, 1) + I(2, 2) < I(0, 0)) {
00344                         error_message("invalid inertia tensor for body %d, I(1,1) + I(2,2) < I(0,0)\n", index);
00345                         error_message("matrix is:\n"
00346                                                   "[%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00347                                                   "%.20e %.20e %.20e;\n"
00348                                                   "%.20e %.20e %.20e]\n",
00349                                                   I(0, 0), I(0, 1), I(0, 2), I(1, 0), I(1, 1), I(1, 2), I(2, 0), I(2, 1),
00350                                                   I(2, 2));
00351                         return false;
00352                 }
00353         }
00354         // check positive/zero diagonal elements
00355         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00356                 if (I(i, i) < 0) {  // accept zero
00357                         error_message("invalid inertia tensor, I(%d,%d)= %e <0\n", i, i, I(i, i));
00358                         return false;
00359                 }
00360         }
00361         // check symmetry
00362         if (BT_ID_FABS(I(1, 0) - I(0, 1)) > kIsZero) {
00363                 error_message("invalid inertia tensor for body %d I(1,0)!=I(0,1). I(1,0)-I(0,1)= "
00364                                           "%e\n",
00365                                           index, I(1, 0) - I(0, 1));
00366                 return false;
00367         }
00368         if (BT_ID_FABS(I(2, 0) - I(0, 2)) > kIsZero) {
00369                 error_message("invalid inertia tensor for body %d I(2,0)!=I(0,2). I(2,0)-I(0,2)= "
00370                                           "%e\n",
00371                                           index, I(2, 0) - I(0, 2));
00372                 return false;
00373         }
00374         if (BT_ID_FABS(I(1, 2) - I(2, 1)) > kIsZero) {
00375                 error_message("invalid inertia tensor body %d I(1,2)!=I(2,1). I(1,2)-I(2,1)= %e\n", index,
00376                                           I(1, 2) - I(2, 1));
00377                 return false;
00378         }
00379         return true;
00380 }
00381 
00382 bool isValidTransformMatrix(const mat33 &m) {
00383 #define print_mat(x)                                                                                                                                                       \
00384         error_message("matrix is [%e, %e, %e; %e, %e, %e; %e, %e, %e]\n", x(0, 0), x(0, 1), x(0, 2),   \
00385                                   x(1, 0), x(1, 1), x(1, 2), x(2, 0), x(2, 1), x(2, 2))
00386 
00387         // check for unit length column vectors
00388         for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00389                 const idScalar length_minus_1 =
00390                         BT_ID_FABS(m(0, i) * m(0, i) + m(1, i) * m(1, i) + m(2, i) * m(2, i) - 1.0);
00391                 if (length_minus_1 > kAxisLengthEpsilon) {
00392                         error_message("Not a valid rotation matrix (column %d not unit length)\n"
00393                                                   "column = [%.18e %.18e %.18e]\n"
00394                                                   "length-1.0= %.18e\n",
00395                                                   i, m(0, i), m(1, i), m(2, i), length_minus_1);
00396                         print_mat(m);
00397                         return false;
00398                 }
00399         }
00400         // check for orthogonal column vectors
00401         if (BT_ID_FABS(m(0, 0) * m(0, 1) + m(1, 0) * m(1, 1) + m(2, 0) * m(2, 1)) > kAxisLengthEpsilon) {
00402                 error_message("Not a valid rotation matrix (columns 0 and 1 not orthogonal)\n");
00403                 print_mat(m);
00404                 return false;
00405         }
00406         if (BT_ID_FABS(m(0, 0) * m(0, 2) + m(1, 0) * m(1, 2) + m(2, 0) * m(2, 2)) > kAxisLengthEpsilon) {
00407                 error_message("Not a valid rotation matrix (columns 0 and 2 not orthogonal)\n");
00408                 print_mat(m);
00409                 return false;
00410         }
00411         if (BT_ID_FABS(m(0, 1) * m(0, 2) + m(1, 1) * m(1, 2) + m(2, 1) * m(2, 2)) > kAxisLengthEpsilon) {
00412                 error_message("Not a valid rotation matrix (columns 0 and 2 not orthogonal)\n");
00413                 print_mat(m);
00414                 return false;
00415         }
00416         // check determinant (rotation not reflection)
00417         if (determinant(m) <= 0) {
00418                 error_message("Not a valid rotation matrix (determinant <=0)\n");
00419                 print_mat(m);
00420                 return false;
00421         }
00422         return true;
00423 }
00424 
00425 bool isUnitVector(const vec3 &vector) {
00426         return BT_ID_FABS(vector(0) * vector(0) + vector(1) * vector(1) + vector(2) * vector(2) - 1.0) <
00427                    kIsZero;
00428 }
00429 
00430 vec3 rpyFromMatrix(const mat33 &rot) {
00431         vec3 rpy;
00432         rpy(2) = BT_ID_ATAN2(-rot(1, 0), rot(0, 0));
00433         rpy(1) = BT_ID_ATAN2(rot(2, 0), BT_ID_COS(rpy(2)) * rot(0, 0) - BT_ID_SIN(rpy(0)) * rot(1, 0));
00434         rpy(0) = BT_ID_ATAN2(-rot(2, 0), rot(2, 2));
00435         return rpy;
00436 }
